%Cc Arc 00001
You are suddenly in familiar surroundings.  The buildings in the distance
appear to be those of your old alma mater, but something is wrong.  It looks
as if there has been a riot recently, or %H has
been under siege.

All of the windows are boarded up, and there are objects scattered around
the entrance.

Strange forbidding shapes seem to be moving in the distance.
%E
%Cp Arc 00002
Once again, you are back at %H.
%E
%Cp Arc 00003
You are back at %H.
You have an odd feeling this may be the last time you ever come here.

A strange feeling washes over you, and you think back to things you
learned during the many lectures of %l.

You realize the feeling must be the presence of %o.

The familiar presence of %o is in the ether.

%Cc Arc 00070
The power of %o flows through your body!  You feel
as if you could now take on the Wizard of Yendor himself and win, but
you know you must return %o to %l.
%E
%Cp Arc 00080
The body of %n dissipates in a cloud of noxious fumes.
%E
%Cc Arc 00081
%lC touches %o briefly, gazes into it,
then smiles at you and says:

"Well done, %p.  You have defeated %n and
recovered %o.  But I fear that it shall never be safe
here.

Please take %o with you.  You, %p, can
guard it now far better than I.

May the blessings of %d follow you and guard you."

# assumes Orb of Detection (glass object)
%Cc Arc 00082
"Careful, %p!  %oC might break, and that would be
a tragic loss.  You are its keeper now, and the time has come to
resume your search for the Amulet.  %Z await your
return through the magic portal that brought you here."
%E
%Cc Arc 00090
"Welcome back, %p.  Have you progressed with your quest to
regain the Amulet of Yendor for %d?"
%E
%Cc Arc 00091
"Congratulations, %p.  I wondered if anyone could prevail against
the Wizard and the minions of Moloch.  Now, you must embark on one
final adventure.

"Take the Amulet, and find your way onto the astral plane.
There you must find the altar of %d and sacrifice the
Amulet on that altar to fulfill your destiny.

"Remember, your path now should always be upwards."
%E
%Cc Arc 00095
"You have betrayed all those who hold allegiance to %d, as you once did.
My allegiance to %d holds fast and I cannot condone or accept what you 
have done.

Leave this place.  You shall never set foot at %H again.
That which you seek is now lost forever, for without the Bell of Opening, 
you will never be able to enter the place where he who has the Amulet 
resides.

Go now!  You are banished from this place.
%E

%Cp Arc 00100
You receive a faint telepathic message from %l:
Your help is urgently needed at %H!
Look for a ...ic transporter.
You couldn't quite make out that last message.
%E
%Cp Arc 00101
You again sense %l pleading for help.
%E
%Cp Arc 00102
"The silver bell which was hoarded by %n will be
essential in locating the Amulet of Yendor."
%E

%Cc Arc 00103
As you enter the Bell Caves, the silver bell radiates brightly!
You immediately know that you've successfully imbued it; after all, this
is the place where the bell has originally been forged, and it regained
its original power by being close to its source.

In order to open the path to Moloch's Sanctum, you need two more artifacts.
They're both said to be hidden in Gehennom, in the possession of powerful
guardians. Only with them in your possession can you perform the ritual
on the deepest level of Gehennom and gain access to the place where
the Amulet of Yendor is kept.
%E
%Cc Arc 00104
The Amulet of Yendor radiates brightly as you enter the Forging Chamber.

In order to be fully imbued, the Amulet must also be taken to the
Dead Grounds and Ordered Chaos subdungeons.
%E
%Cc Arc 00105
The Amulet of Yendor radiates brightly as you enter the Dead Grounds.

In order to be fully imbued, the Amulet must also be taken to the
Forging Chamber and Ordered Chaos subdungeons.
%E
%Cc Arc 00106
The Amulet of Yendor radiates brightly as you enter the Ordered Chaos.

In order to be fully imbued, the Amulet must also be taken to the
Forging Chamber and Dead Grounds subdungeons.
%E
%Cc Arc 00107
At last, you have fully imbued the Amulet of Yendor! You know that now
you have to get to the surface, where your final test awaits.

A strange sensation seems to pull you downwards. This must surely be
the power of the Amulet, and you get ready to traverse Moloch's Sanctum
and Gehennom again.

You also notice the Wizard of Yendor taunting you in your mind.
He must surely have noticed that the Amulet has gained full power now,
and will try his best to stop you on your ascension run...
%E
%Cc Arc 00108
This seemingly mundane gray stone makes you feel lucky as you pick it up!
It must hold a good charm, and you decide to hold onto it.
%E
%Cc Arc 00109
After a long period of pushing boulders around, you've found a prize.
'Well, at least there is some reward for the hell that is slexoban',
you think, as you pick up this valuable item. It might come in handy
on the path that lies ahead.
%E
%Cc Arc 00110
As the dreadful Medusa finally stops living, you feel an immense burden
lifted from your chest. You now know that you're a capable adventurer,
one who can defeat creatures from legend and live to tell the tale.

Hopefully, you are now ready to face the greater tasks that lie ahead.
%E
%Cc Arc 00111
This menora surely seems important. It must be one of the artifacts
required for the ominous invocation ritual!

You must get two more of these artifacts. One of them is said to be
in the possession of the Wizard of Yendor himself, who is lurking
somewhere in Gehennom; the other such artifact can be obtained if
you engage your personal nemesis in a duel and win...
%E
%Cc Arc 00112
Quickly, you snatch the papyrus spellbook that the Wizard of Yendor
was holding. It is obviously one of the key pieces in your mission
to open the sanctum at the deepest level of Gehennom, but you also
need the silver bell from your quest nemesis, and one more such
artifact is hidden somewhere in Gehennom.
%E
%Cc Arc 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,
for you know that %d desires this amulet. But something is amiss.

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!
%E
%Cc Arc 00114
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar to %d at last,
you immediately feel an intense surge of power.

You have faced many hardships, survived encounters with deadly
beasts, and even battled the Wizard of Yendor himself and won.
Not to forget carving a path through the Elemental Planes, slaying
their denizens left and right, culminating in the Astral Plane,
where you mowed down all the heretical angels and priests trying
to prevent you from delivering the Amulet to %d.

But now, the entire world around you seems to stop for a moment.
You truly are a demigod now. %d is smiling on you, and leads you
to a place known as the Demigod Bar: Here, the other successful
adventurers are gathered, and they're happily drinking and telling
their stories...

And you get to join them!!! You did it, you've officially become
a true master at your trade, and saved the world from Moloch's
evil schemes! Immediately, you rush to greet your new friends
to tell them about your heroic deeds.

Congraturation! A winner is you! You've beaten SLASH'EM Extended,
one of the most difficult and unfair roguelikes in existence!
Make sure to tell Amy (the creator of the game) about it, too! :-)
%E
%Cc Arc 00115
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar,
you somehow don't feel any different at first.

But it has to be true! You just offered the Amulet to %d,
and should be made a demigod any minute now...

Death, Pestilence and Famine still look as threatening as ever.
Something must be very wrong here. Shouldn't you be safe now,
considering you went through Hell and back to get the Amulet
of Yendor for your deity?

Death reaches out with its deadly touch.
You feel your life draining away...
Pestilence reaches out, and you feel fever and chills.
You feel deathly sick.
Famine reaches out, and your body shrivels.
You faint from lack of food.

On the verge of death, you listen to a voice...
'Foolish mortal, thou art an imbecile poltroon.
But since thou bringest me the Amulet I desired,
I shall let thee live. Thou mayst leave the Dungeon now.'

SHIT! Due to a silly mistake, you failed so close to your goal!
You forgot to make sure that the high altar is actually
consecrated to %d, and offered the Amulet of Yendor to the wrong
deity!

Do you want your possessions identified? DYWYPI?
Game over! Please insert a coin to start a new game.
%E
%Cc Arc 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly
vibrating right beneath you.

This must be the special place where the entrance to
Moloch's sanctum is hidden! In order to open it, you need all three
of the invocation tools: Book, Bell and Candle. And then you have
to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...
%E
%Cc Arc 00117
This peculiar gray stone makes you feel both good and bad at once.
It must surely have great magical power, but there seems to be
some sort of curse on it too.
Maybe if you somehow lift the curse, it will become a truly
useful talisman that can protect you from harm?
%E

Hopefully, you are now ready to face the greater tasks that lie ahead.
%E
%Cc Occ 00111
This menora surely seems important. It must be one of the artifacts
required for the ominous invocation ritual!

You must get two more of these artifacts. One of them is said to be
in the possession of the Wizard of Yendor himself, who is lurking
somewhere in Gehennom; the other such artifact can be obtained if
you engage your personal nemesis in a duel and win...
%E
%Cc Occ 00112
Quickly, you snatch the papyrus spellbook that the Wizard of Yendor
was holding. It is obviously one of the key pieces in your mission
to open the sanctum at the deepest level of Gehennom, but you also
need the silver bell from your quest nemesis, and one more such
artifact is hidden somewhere in Gehennom.
%E
%Cc Occ 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,
for you know that %d desires this amulet. But something is amiss.

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!
%E
%Cc Occ 00114
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar to %d at last,
you immediately feel an intense surge of power.

You have faced many hardships, survived encounters with deadly
beasts, and even battled the Wizard of Yendor himself and won.
Not to forget carving a path through the Elemental Planes, slaying
their denizens left and right, culminating in the Astral Plane,
where you mowed down all the heretical angels and priests trying
to prevent you from delivering the Amulet to %d.

But now, the entire world around you seems to stop for a moment.
You truly are a demigod now. %d is smiling on you, and leads you
to a place known as the Demigod Bar: Here, the other successful
adventurers are gathered, and they're happily drinking and telling
their stories...

And you get to join them!!! You did it, you've officially become
a true master at your trade, and saved the world from Moloch's
evil schemes! Immediately, you rush to greet your new friends
to tell them about your heroic deeds.

Congraturation! A winner is you! You've beaten SLASH'EM Extended,
one of the most difficult and unfair roguelikes in existence!
Make sure to tell Amy (the creator of the game) about it, too! :-)
%E
%Cc Occ 00115
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar,
you somehow don't feel any different at first.

But it has to be true! You just offered the Amulet to %d,
and should be made a demigod any minute now...

Death, Pestilence and Famine still look as threatening as ever.
Something must be very wrong here. Shouldn't you be safe now,
considering you went through Hell and back to get the Amulet
of Yendor for your deity?

Death reaches out with its deadly touch.
You feel your life draining away...
Pestilence reaches out, and you feel fever and chills.
You feel deathly sick.
Famine reaches out, and your body shrivels.
You faint from lack of food.

On the verge of death, you listen to a voice...
'Foolish mortal, thou art an imbecile poltroon.
But since thou bringest me the Amulet I desired,
I shall let thee live. Thou mayst leave the Dungeon now.'

SHIT! Due to a silly mistake, you failed so close to your goal!
You forgot to make sure that the high altar is actually
consecrated to %d, and offered the Amulet of Yendor to the wrong
deity!

Do you want your possessions identified? DYWYPI?
Game over! Please insert a coin to start a new game.
%E
%Cc Occ 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly
vibrating right beneath you.

This must be the special place where the entrance to
Moloch's sanctum is hidden! In order to open it, you need all three
of the invocation tools: Book, Bell and Candle. And then you have
to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...
%E
%Cc Occ 00117
This peculiar gray stone makes you feel both good and bad at once.
It must surely have great magical power, but there seems to be
some sort of curse on it too.
Maybe if you somehow lift the curse, it will become a truly
useful talisman that can protect you from harm?

you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!

The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!

to prevent you from delivering the Amulet to %d.

But now, the entire world around you seems to stop for a moment.

%Cc Zoo 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly

this exact floor tile.

the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...

the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...

%Cc Brd 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,
for you know that %d desires this amulet. But something is amiss.

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!
%E
%Cc Brd 00114

you immediately feel an intense surge of power.

You have faced many hardships, survived encounters with deadly
beasts, and even battled the Wizard of Yendor himself and won.
Not to forget carving a path through the Elemental Planes, slaying
their denizens left and right, culminating in the Astral Plane,
where you mowed down all the heretical angels and priests trying
to prevent you from delivering the Amulet to %d.

But now, the entire world around you seems to stop for a moment.
You truly are a demigod now. %d is smiling on you, and leads you
to a place known as the Demigod Bar: Here, the other successful
adventurers are gathered, and they're happily drinking and telling
their stories...

And you get to join them!!! You did it, you've officially become
a true master at your trade, and saved the world from Moloch's
evil schemes! Immediately, you rush to greet your new friends
to tell them about your heroic deeds.

Congraturation! A winner is you! You've beaten SLASH'EM Extended,
one of the most difficult and unfair roguelikes in existence!
Make sure to tell Amy (the creator of the game) about it, too! :-)

I shall let thee live. Thou mayst leave the Dungeon now.'

Game over! Please insert a coin to start a new game.

%Cc Brd 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly
vibrating right beneath you.

This must be the special place where the entrance to
Moloch's sanctum is hidden! In order to open it, you need all three
of the invocation tools: Book, Bell and Candle. And then you have
to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...

%Cc Use 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,
for you know that %d desires this amulet. But something is amiss.

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!
%E
%Cc Use 00114
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar to %d at last,

beasts, and even battled the Wizard of Yendor himself and won.
Not to forget carving a path through the Elemental Planes, slaying
their denizens left and right, culminating in the Astral Plane,
where you mowed down all the heretical angels and priests trying
to prevent you from delivering the Amulet to %d.

But now, the entire world around you seems to stop for a moment.
You truly are a demigod now. %d is smiling on you, and leads you
to a place known as the Demigod Bar: Here, the other successful
adventurers are gathered, and they're happily drinking and telling
their stories...

And you get to join them!!! You did it, you've officially become
a true master at your trade, and saved the world from Moloch's
evil schemes! Immediately, you rush to greet your new friends
to tell them about your heroic deeds.

Congraturation! A winner is you! You've beaten SLASH'EM Extended,
one of the most difficult and unfair roguelikes in existence!
Make sure to tell Amy (the creator of the game) about it, too! :-)

%Cc Use 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly
vibrating right beneath you.

This must be the special place where the entrance to
Moloch's sanctum is hidden! In order to open it, you need all three
of the invocation tools: Book, Bell and Candle. And then you have
to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...

useful talisman that can protect you from harm?

%Cc Pok 00103
As you enter the Bell Caves, the silver bell radiates brightly!
You immediately know that you've successfully imbued it; after all, this
is the place where the bell has originally been forged, and it regained
its original power by being close to its source.

In order to open the path to Moloch's Sanctum, you need two more artifacts.
They're both said to be hidden in Gehennom, in the possession of powerful
guardians. Only with them in your possession can you perform the ritual
on the deepest level of Gehennom and gain access to the place where
the Amulet of Yendor is kept.
%E
%Cc Pok 00104
The Amulet of Yendor radiates brightly as you enter the Forging Chamber.

In order to be fully imbued, the Amulet must also be taken to the
Dead Grounds and Ordered Chaos subdungeons.
%E
%Cc Pok 00105
The Amulet of Yendor radiates brightly as you enter the Dead Grounds.

In order to be fully imbued, the Amulet must also be taken to the
Forging Chamber and Ordered Chaos subdungeons.
%E
%Cc Pok 00106
The Amulet of Yendor radiates brightly as you enter the Ordered Chaos.

In order to be fully imbued, the Amulet must also be taken to the
Forging Chamber and Dead Grounds subdungeons.
%E
%Cc Pok 00107
At last, you have fully imbued the Amulet of Yendor! You know that now
you have to get to the surface, where your final test awaits.

A strange sensation seems to pull you downwards. This must surely be
the power of the Amulet, and you get ready to traverse Moloch's Sanctum
and Gehennom again.

You also notice the Wizard of Yendor taunting you in your mind.
He must surely have noticed that the Amulet has gained full power now,
and will try his best to stop you on your ascension run...
%E
%Cc Pok 00108
This seemingly mundane gray stone makes you feel lucky as you pick it up!
It must hold a good charm, and you decide to hold onto it.
%E
%Cc Pok 00109
After a long period of pushing boulders around, you've found a prize.
'Well, at least there is some reward for the hell that is slexoban',
you think, as you pick up this valuable item. It might come in handy
on the path that lies ahead.
%E
%Cc Pok 00110
As the dreadful Medusa finally stops living, you feel an immense burden
lifted from your chest. You now know that you're a capable adventurer,
one who can defeat creatures from legend and live to tell the tale.

Hopefully, you are now ready to face the greater tasks that lie ahead.
%E
%Cc Pok 00111
This menora surely seems important. It must be one of the artifacts
required for the ominous invocation ritual!

You must get two more of these artifacts. One of them is said to be
in the possession of the Wizard of Yendor himself, who is lurking
somewhere in Gehennom; the other such artifact can be obtained if
you engage your personal nemesis in a duel and win...
%E
%Cc Pok 00112
Quickly, you snatch the papyrus spellbook that the Wizard of Yendor
was holding. It is obviously one of the key pieces in your mission
to open the sanctum at the deepest level of Gehennom, but you also
need the silver bell from your quest nemesis, and one more such
artifact is hidden somewhere in Gehennom.
%E
%Cc Pok 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,
for you know that %d desires this amulet. But something is amiss.

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!
%E
%Cc Pok 00114
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar to %d at last,
you immediately feel an intense surge of power.

You have faced many hardships, survived encounters with deadly
beasts, and even battled the Wizard of Yendor himself and won.
Not to forget carving a path through the Elemental Planes, slaying
their denizens left and right, culminating in the Astral Plane,
where you mowed down all the heretical angels and priests trying
to prevent you from delivering the Amulet to %d.

But now, the entire world around you seems to stop for a moment.
You truly are a demigod now. %d is smiling on you, and leads you
to a place known as the Demigod Bar: Here, the other successful
adventurers are gathered, and they're happily drinking and telling
their stories...

And you get to join them!!! You did it, you've officially become
a true master at your trade, and saved the world from Moloch's
evil schemes! Immediately, you rush to greet your new friends
to tell them about your heroic deeds.

Congraturation! A winner is you! You've beaten SLASH'EM Extended,
one of the most difficult and unfair roguelikes in existence!
Make sure to tell Amy (the creator of the game) about it, too! :-)
%E
%Cc Pok 00115
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar,
you somehow don't feel any different at first.

But it has to be true! You just offered the Amulet to %d,
and should be made a demigod any minute now...

Death, Pestilence and Famine still look as threatening as ever.
Something must be very wrong here. Shouldn't you be safe now,
considering you went through Hell and back to get the Amulet
of Yendor for your deity?

Death reaches out with its deadly touch.
You feel your life draining away...
Pestilence reaches out, and you feel fever and chills.
You feel deathly sick.
Famine reaches out, and your body shrivels.
You faint from lack of food.

On the verge of death, you listen to a voice...
'Foolish mortal, thou art an imbecile poltroon.
But since thou bringest me the Amulet I desired,
I shall let thee live. Thou mayst leave the Dungeon now.'

SHIT! Due to a silly mistake, you failed so close to your goal!
You forgot to make sure that the high altar is actually
consecrated to %d, and offered the Amulet of Yendor to the wrong
deity!

Do you want your possessions identified? DYWYPI?
Game over! Please insert a coin to start a new game.
%E
%Cc Pok 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly
vibrating right beneath you.

This must be the special place where the entrance to
Moloch's sanctum is hidden! In order to open it, you need all three
of the invocation tools: Book, Bell and Candle. And then you have
to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...
%E
%Cc Pok 00117
This peculiar gray stone makes you feel both good and bad at once.
It must surely have great magical power, but there seems to be
some sort of curse on it too.
Maybe if you somehow lift the curse, it will become a truly
useful talisman that can protect you from harm?

the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.

%Cc Cel 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!

staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!

you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!

%Cc Tra 00103
As you enter the Bell Caves, the silver bell radiates brightly!
You immediately know that you've successfully imbued it; after all, this
is the place where the bell has originally been forged, and it regained
its original power by being close to its source.

In order to open the path to Moloch's Sanctum, you need two more artifacts.
They're both said to be hidden in Gehennom, in the possession of powerful
guardians. Only with them in your possession can you perform the ritual
on the deepest level of Gehennom and gain access to the place where
the Amulet of Yendor is kept.
%E
%Cc Tra 00104
The Amulet of Yendor radiates brightly as you enter the Forging Chamber.

In order to be fully imbued, the Amulet must also be taken to the
Dead Grounds and Ordered Chaos subdungeons.
%E
%Cc Tra 00105
The Amulet of Yendor radiates brightly as you enter the Dead Grounds.

%Cc Tra 00106

and Gehennom again.

You also notice the Wizard of Yendor taunting you in your mind.
He must surely have noticed that the Amulet has gained full power now,
and will try his best to stop you on your ascension run...

%Cc Tra 00110

%Cc Tra 00111
This menora surely seems important. It must be one of the artifacts
required for the ominous invocation ritual!

You must get two more of these artifacts. One of them is said to be
in the possession of the Wizard of Yendor himself, who is lurking
somewhere in Gehennom; the other such artifact can be obtained if
you engage your personal nemesis in a duel and win...
%E
%Cc Tra 00112
Quickly, you snatch the papyrus spellbook that the Wizard of Yendor
was holding. It is obviously one of the key pieces in your mission
to open the sanctum at the deepest level of Gehennom, but you also
need the silver bell from your quest nemesis, and one more such
artifact is hidden somewhere in Gehennom.
%E
%Cc Tra 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,
for you know that %d desires this amulet. But something is amiss.

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!
%E
%Cc Tra 00114
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar to %d at last,
you immediately feel an intense surge of power.

You have faced many hardships, survived encounters with deadly
beasts, and even battled the Wizard of Yendor himself and won.
Not to forget carving a path through the Elemental Planes, slaying
their denizens left and right, culminating in the Astral Plane,
where you mowed down all the heretical angels and priests trying
to prevent you from delivering the Amulet to %d.

But now, the entire world around you seems to stop for a moment.
You truly are a demigod now. %d is smiling on you, and leads you
to a place known as the Demigod Bar: Here, the other successful
adventurers are gathered, and they're happily drinking and telling
their stories...

And you get to join them!!! You did it, you've officially become
a true master at your trade, and saved the world from Moloch's
evil schemes! Immediately, you rush to greet your new friends
to tell them about your heroic deeds.

Congraturation! A winner is you! You've beaten SLASH'EM Extended,
one of the most difficult and unfair roguelikes in existence!
Make sure to tell Amy (the creator of the game) about it, too! :-)
%E
%Cc Tra 00115
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar,
you somehow don't feel any different at first.

But it has to be true! You just offered the Amulet to %d,
and should be made a demigod any minute now...

Death, Pestilence and Famine still look as threatening as ever.
Something must be very wrong here. Shouldn't you be safe now,
considering you went through Hell and back to get the Amulet
of Yendor for your deity?

Death reaches out with its deadly touch.
You feel your life draining away...
Pestilence reaches out, and you feel fever and chills.
You feel deathly sick.
Famine reaches out, and your body shrivels.
You faint from lack of food.

On the verge of death, you listen to a voice...
'Foolish mortal, thou art an imbecile poltroon.
But since thou bringest me the Amulet I desired,
I shall let thee live. Thou mayst leave the Dungeon now.'

SHIT! Due to a silly mistake, you failed so close to your goal!
You forgot to make sure that the high altar is actually
consecrated to %d, and offered the Amulet of Yendor to the wrong
deity!

Do you want your possessions identified? DYWYPI?
Game over! Please insert a coin to start a new game.
%E
%Cc Tra 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly
vibrating right beneath you.

This must be the special place where the entrance to
Moloch's sanctum is hidden! In order to open it, you need all three
of the invocation tools: Book, Bell and Candle. And then you have
to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...
%E

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!

this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...

%Cc Mys 00103
As you enter the Bell Caves, the silver bell radiates brightly!
You immediately know that you've successfully imbued it; after all, this
is the place where the bell has originally been forged, and it regained
its original power by being close to its source.

In order to open the path to Moloch's Sanctum, you need two more artifacts.
They're both said to be hidden in Gehennom, in the possession of powerful
guardians. Only with them in your possession can you perform the ritual
on the deepest level of Gehennom and gain access to the place where
the Amulet of Yendor is kept.

and Gehennom again.

He must surely have noticed that the Amulet has gained full power now,
and will try his best to stop you on your ascension run...

%Cc Gof 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,
for you know that %d desires this amulet. But something is amiss.

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!

But now, the entire world around you seems to stop for a moment.

%Cc Gof 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...

%Cc Unb 00113

let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!

adventurers are gathered, and they're happily drinking and telling
their stories...

a true master at your trade, and saved the world from Moloch's
evil schemes! Immediately, you rush to greet your new friends
to tell them about your heroic deeds.

Congraturation! A winner is you! You've beaten SLASH'EM Extended,
one of the most difficult and unfair roguelikes in existence!

I shall let thee live. Thou mayst leave the Dungeon now.'

deity!

Game over! Please insert a coin to start a new game.

%Cc Unb 00116

to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...

%Cc Blo 00112
Quickly, you snatch the papyrus spellbook that the Wizard of Yendor

%E
%Cc Blo 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,
for you know that %d desires this amulet. But something is amiss.

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!
%E
%Cc Blo 00114
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar to %d at last,
you immediately feel an intense surge of power.

You have faced many hardships, survived encounters with deadly
beasts, and even battled the Wizard of Yendor himself and won.
Not to forget carving a path through the Elemental Planes, slaying
their denizens left and right, culminating in the Astral Plane,
where you mowed down all the heretical angels and priests trying
to prevent you from delivering the Amulet to %d.

But now, the entire world around you seems to stop for a moment.
You truly are a demigod now. %d is smiling on you, and leads you
to a place known as the Demigod Bar: Here, the other successful
adventurers are gathered, and they're happily drinking and telling
their stories...

And you get to join them!!! You did it, you've officially become
a true master at your trade, and saved the world from Moloch's
evil schemes! Immediately, you rush to greet your new friends
to tell them about your heroic deeds.

Congraturation! A winner is you! You've beaten SLASH'EM Extended,
one of the most difficult and unfair roguelikes in existence!
Make sure to tell Amy (the creator of the game) about it, too! :-)

%Cc Blo 00115
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar,

Death, Pestilence and Famine still look as threatening as ever.

I shall let thee live. Thou mayst leave the Dungeon now.'

%Cc Blo 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly
vibrating right beneath you.

This must be the special place where the entrance to
Moloch's sanctum is hidden! In order to open it, you need all three
of the invocation tools: Book, Bell and Candle. And then you have
to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...

%Cc Mar 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,
for you know that %d desires this amulet. But something is amiss.

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!

beasts, and even battled the Wizard of Yendor himself and won.
Not to forget carving a path through the Elemental Planes, slaying
their denizens left and right, culminating in the Astral Plane,
where you mowed down all the heretical angels and priests trying
to prevent you from delivering the Amulet to %d.

But now, the entire world around you seems to stop for a moment.
You truly are a demigod now. %d is smiling on you, and leads you
to a place known as the Demigod Bar: Here, the other successful
adventurers are gathered, and they're happily drinking and telling
their stories...

And you get to join them!!! You did it, you've officially become
a true master at your trade, and saved the world from Moloch's
evil schemes! Immediately, you rush to greet your new friends
to tell them about your heroic deeds.

Congraturation! A winner is you! You've beaten SLASH'EM Extended,
one of the most difficult and unfair roguelikes in existence!
Make sure to tell Amy (the creator of the game) about it, too! :-)

%Cc Mar 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly
vibrating right beneath you.

This must be the special place where the entrance to
Moloch's sanctum is hidden! In order to open it, you need all three
of the invocation tools: Book, Bell and Candle. And then you have
to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...

%Cc Gla 00113

you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!

%Cc Ble 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!

%Cc Ble 00116

to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...

you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!

%Cc Sof 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,
for you know that %d desires this amulet. But something is amiss.

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!
%E
%Cc Sof 00114
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar to %d at last,
you immediately feel an intense surge of power.

You have faced many hardships, survived encounters with deadly
beasts, and even battled the Wizard of Yendor himself and won.
Not to forget carving a path through the Elemental Planes, slaying
their denizens left and right, culminating in the Astral Plane,
where you mowed down all the heretical angels and priests trying
to prevent you from delivering the Amulet to %d.

But now, the entire world around you seems to stop for a moment.
You truly are a demigod now. %d is smiling on you, and leads you
to a place known as the Demigod Bar: Here, the other successful
adventurers are gathered, and they're happily drinking and telling
their stories...

And you get to join them!!! You did it, you've officially become
a true master at your trade, and saved the world from Moloch's
evil schemes! Immediately, you rush to greet your new friends
to tell them about your heroic deeds.

Congraturation! A winner is you! You've beaten SLASH'EM Extended,
one of the most difficult and unfair roguelikes in existence!
Make sure to tell Amy (the creator of the game) about it, too! :-)

As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar,

Death, Pestilence and Famine still look as threatening as ever.

Famine reaches out, and your body shrivels.

I shall let thee live. Thou mayst leave the Dungeon now.'

%Cc Sof 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly
vibrating right beneath you.

This must be the special place where the entrance to
Moloch's sanctum is hidden! In order to open it, you need all three
of the invocation tools: Book, Bell and Candle. And then you have
to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...

%Cc Jan 00103
As you enter the Bell Caves, the silver bell radiates brightly!
You immediately know that you've successfully imbued it; after all, this
is the place where the bell has originally been forged, and it regained
its original power by being close to its source.

In order to open the path to Moloch's Sanctum, you need two more artifacts.
They're both said to be hidden in Gehennom, in the possession of powerful
guardians. Only with them in your possession can you perform the ritual
on the deepest level of Gehennom and gain access to the place where
the Amulet of Yendor is kept.
%E
%Cc Jan 00104
The Amulet of Yendor radiates brightly as you enter the Forging Chamber.

In order to be fully imbued, the Amulet must also be taken to the
Dead Grounds and Ordered Chaos subdungeons.
%E
%Cc Jan 00105
The Amulet of Yendor radiates brightly as you enter the Dead Grounds.

In order to be fully imbued, the Amulet must also be taken to the
Forging Chamber and Ordered Chaos subdungeons.
%E
%Cc Jan 00106
The Amulet of Yendor radiates brightly as you enter the Ordered Chaos.

In order to be fully imbued, the Amulet must also be taken to the
Forging Chamber and Dead Grounds subdungeons.
%E
%Cc Jan 00107
At last, you have fully imbued the Amulet of Yendor! You know that now
you have to get to the surface, where your final test awaits.

A strange sensation seems to pull you downwards. This must surely be
the power of the Amulet, and you get ready to traverse Moloch's Sanctum
and Gehennom again.

You also notice the Wizard of Yendor taunting you in your mind.
He must surely have noticed that the Amulet has gained full power now,
and will try his best to stop you on your ascension run...
%E
%Cc Jan 00108
This seemingly mundane gray stone makes you feel lucky as you pick it up!
It must hold a good charm, and you decide to hold onto it.
%E
%Cc Jan 00109
After a long period of pushing boulders around, you've found a prize.
'Well, at least there is some reward for the hell that is slexoban',
you think, as you pick up this valuable item. It might come in handy
on the path that lies ahead.
%E
%Cc Jan 00110
As the dreadful Medusa finally stops living, you feel an immense burden
lifted from your chest. You now know that you're a capable adventurer,
one who can defeat creatures from legend and live to tell the tale.

Hopefully, you are now ready to face the greater tasks that lie ahead.
%E
%Cc Jan 00111
This menora surely seems important. It must be one of the artifacts
required for the ominous invocation ritual!

You must get two more of these artifacts. One of them is said to be
in the possession of the Wizard of Yendor himself, who is lurking
somewhere in Gehennom; the other such artifact can be obtained if
you engage your personal nemesis in a duel and win...
%E
%Cc Jan 00112
Quickly, you snatch the papyrus spellbook that the Wizard of Yendor
was holding. It is obviously one of the key pieces in your mission
to open the sanctum at the deepest level of Gehennom, but you also
need the silver bell from your quest nemesis, and one more such
artifact is hidden somewhere in Gehennom.
%E
%Cc Jan 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,
for you know that %d desires this amulet. But something is amiss.

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!
%E
%Cc Jan 00114
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar to %d at last,
you immediately feel an intense surge of power.

You have faced many hardships, survived encounters with deadly
beasts, and even battled the Wizard of Yendor himself and won.
Not to forget carving a path through the Elemental Planes, slaying
their denizens left and right, culminating in the Astral Plane,
where you mowed down all the heretical angels and priests trying
to prevent you from delivering the Amulet to %d.

But now, the entire world around you seems to stop for a moment.
You truly are a demigod now. %d is smiling on you, and leads you
to a place known as the Demigod Bar: Here, the other successful
adventurers are gathered, and they're happily drinking and telling
their stories...

And you get to join them!!! You did it, you've officially become
a true master at your trade, and saved the world from Moloch's
evil schemes! Immediately, you rush to greet your new friends
to tell them about your heroic deeds.

Congraturation! A winner is you! You've beaten SLASH'EM Extended,
one of the most difficult and unfair roguelikes in existence!
Make sure to tell Amy (the creator of the game) about it, too! :-)
%E
%Cc Jan 00115
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar,
you somehow don't feel any different at first.

But it has to be true! You just offered the Amulet to %d,
and should be made a demigod any minute now...

Death, Pestilence and Famine still look as threatening as ever.
Something must be very wrong here. Shouldn't you be safe now,
considering you went through Hell and back to get the Amulet
of Yendor for your deity?

Death reaches out with its deadly touch.
You feel your life draining away...
Pestilence reaches out, and you feel fever and chills.
You feel deathly sick.
Famine reaches out, and your body shrivels.
You faint from lack of food.

On the verge of death, you listen to a voice...
'Foolish mortal, thou art an imbecile poltroon.
But since thou bringest me the Amulet I desired,
I shall let thee live. Thou mayst leave the Dungeon now.'

SHIT! Due to a silly mistake, you failed so close to your goal!
You forgot to make sure that the high altar is actually
consecrated to %d, and offered the Amulet of Yendor to the wrong
deity!

Do you want your possessions identified? DYWYPI?
Game over! Please insert a coin to start a new game.
%E
%Cc Jan 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly
vibrating right beneath you.

This must be the special place where the entrance to
Moloch's sanctum is hidden! In order to open it, you need all three
of the invocation tools: Book, Bell and Candle. And then you have
to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...
%E
%Cc Jan 00117
This peculiar gray stone makes you feel both good and bad at once.
It must surely have great magical power, but there seems to be
some sort of curse on it too.
Maybe if you somehow lift the curse, it will become a truly
useful talisman that can protect you from harm?

%Cc Sto 00103
As you enter the Bell Caves, the silver bell radiates brightly!
You immediately know that you've successfully imbued it; after all, this
is the place where the bell has originally been forged, and it regained
its original power by being close to its source.

In order to open the path to Moloch's Sanctum, you need two more artifacts.
They're both said to be hidden in Gehennom, in the possession of powerful
guardians. Only with them in your possession can you perform the ritual
on the deepest level of Gehennom and gain access to the place where
the Amulet of Yendor is kept.
%E
%Cc Sto 00104
The Amulet of Yendor radiates brightly as you enter the Forging Chamber.

In order to be fully imbued, the Amulet must also be taken to the
Dead Grounds and Ordered Chaos subdungeons.
%E
%Cc Sto 00105
The Amulet of Yendor radiates brightly as you enter the Dead Grounds.

In order to be fully imbued, the Amulet must also be taken to the
Forging Chamber and Ordered Chaos subdungeons.
%E
%Cc Sto 00106
The Amulet of Yendor radiates brightly as you enter the Ordered Chaos.

In order to be fully imbued, the Amulet must also be taken to the
Forging Chamber and Dead Grounds subdungeons.
%E
%Cc Sto 00107
At last, you have fully imbued the Amulet of Yendor! You know that now
you have to get to the surface, where your final test awaits.

A strange sensation seems to pull you downwards. This must surely be
the power of the Amulet, and you get ready to traverse Moloch's Sanctum
and Gehennom again.

You also notice the Wizard of Yendor taunting you in your mind.
He must surely have noticed that the Amulet has gained full power now,
and will try his best to stop you on your ascension run...
%E
%Cc Sto 00108
This seemingly mundane gray stone makes you feel lucky as you pick it up!
It must hold a good charm, and you decide to hold onto it.
%E
%Cc Sto 00109
After a long period of pushing boulders around, you've found a prize.
'Well, at least there is some reward for the hell that is slexoban',
you think, as you pick up this valuable item. It might come in handy
on the path that lies ahead.
%E
%Cc Sto 00110
As the dreadful Medusa finally stops living, you feel an immense burden
lifted from your chest. You now know that you're a capable adventurer,
one who can defeat creatures from legend and live to tell the tale.

Hopefully, you are now ready to face the greater tasks that lie ahead.
%E
%Cc Sto 00111
This menora surely seems important. It must be one of the artifacts
required for the ominous invocation ritual!

You must get two more of these artifacts. One of them is said to be
in the possession of the Wizard of Yendor himself, who is lurking
somewhere in Gehennom; the other such artifact can be obtained if
you engage your personal nemesis in a duel and win...
%E
%Cc Sto 00112
Quickly, you snatch the papyrus spellbook that the Wizard of Yendor
was holding. It is obviously one of the key pieces in your mission
to open the sanctum at the deepest level of Gehennom, but you also
need the silver bell from your quest nemesis, and one more such
artifact is hidden somewhere in Gehennom.
%E
%Cc Sto 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,
for you know that %d desires this amulet. But something is amiss.

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!
%E
%Cc Sto 00114
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar to %d at last,
you immediately feel an intense surge of power.

You have faced many hardships, survived encounters with deadly
beasts, and even battled the Wizard of Yendor himself and won.
Not to forget carving a path through the Elemental Planes, slaying
their denizens left and right, culminating in the Astral Plane,
where you mowed down all the heretical angels and priests trying
to prevent you from delivering the Amulet to %d.

But now, the entire world around you seems to stop for a moment.
You truly are a demigod now. %d is smiling on you, and leads you
to a place known as the Demigod Bar: Here, the other successful
adventurers are gathered, and they're happily drinking and telling
their stories...

And you get to join them!!! You did it, you've officially become
a true master at your trade, and saved the world from Moloch's
evil schemes! Immediately, you rush to greet your new friends
to tell them about your heroic deeds.

Congraturation! A winner is you! You've beaten SLASH'EM Extended,
one of the most difficult and unfair roguelikes in existence!
Make sure to tell Amy (the creator of the game) about it, too! :-)
%E
%Cc Sto 00115
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar,
you somehow don't feel any different at first.

But it has to be true! You just offered the Amulet to %d,
and should be made a demigod any minute now...

Death, Pestilence and Famine still look as threatening as ever.
Something must be very wrong here. Shouldn't you be safe now,
considering you went through Hell and back to get the Amulet
of Yendor for your deity?

Death reaches out with its deadly touch.
You feel your life draining away...
Pestilence reaches out, and you feel fever and chills.
You feel deathly sick.
Famine reaches out, and your body shrivels.
You faint from lack of food.

On the verge of death, you listen to a voice...
'Foolish mortal, thou art an imbecile poltroon.
But since thou bringest me the Amulet I desired,
I shall let thee live. Thou mayst leave the Dungeon now.'

SHIT! Due to a silly mistake, you failed so close to your goal!
You forgot to make sure that the high altar is actually
consecrated to %d, and offered the Amulet of Yendor to the wrong
deity!

Do you want your possessions identified? DYWYPI?
Game over! Please insert a coin to start a new game.
%E
%Cc Sto 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly
vibrating right beneath you.

This must be the special place where the entrance to
Moloch's sanctum is hidden! In order to open it, you need all three
of the invocation tools: Book, Bell and Candle. And then you have
to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...
%E
%Cc Sto 00117
This peculiar gray stone makes you feel both good and bad at once.
It must surely have great magical power, but there seems to be
some sort of curse on it too.
Maybe if you somehow lift the curse, it will become a truly
useful talisman that can protect you from harm?
%E

%Cc Qua 00103
As you enter the Bell Caves, the silver bell radiates brightly!
You immediately know that you've successfully imbued it; after all, this
is the place where the bell has originally been forged, and it regained
its original power by being close to its source.

In order to open the path to Moloch's Sanctum, you need two more artifacts.
They're both said to be hidden in Gehennom, in the possession of powerful
guardians. Only with them in your possession can you perform the ritual
on the deepest level of Gehennom and gain access to the place where
the Amulet of Yendor is kept.
%E
%Cc Qua 00104
The Amulet of Yendor radiates brightly as you enter the Forging Chamber.

In order to be fully imbued, the Amulet must also be taken to the
Dead Grounds and Ordered Chaos subdungeons.
%E
%Cc Qua 00105
The Amulet of Yendor radiates brightly as you enter the Dead Grounds.

In order to be fully imbued, the Amulet must also be taken to the
Forging Chamber and Ordered Chaos subdungeons.
%E
%Cc Qua 00106
The Amulet of Yendor radiates brightly as you enter the Ordered Chaos.

In order to be fully imbued, the Amulet must also be taken to the
Forging Chamber and Dead Grounds subdungeons.
%E
%Cc Qua 00107
At last, you have fully imbued the Amulet of Yendor! You know that now
you have to get to the surface, where your final test awaits.

A strange sensation seems to pull you downwards. This must surely be
the power of the Amulet, and you get ready to traverse Moloch's Sanctum
and Gehennom again.

You also notice the Wizard of Yendor taunting you in your mind.
He must surely have noticed that the Amulet has gained full power now,
and will try his best to stop you on your ascension run...
%E
%Cc Qua 00108
This seemingly mundane gray stone makes you feel lucky as you pick it up!
It must hold a good charm, and you decide to hold onto it.
%E
%Cc Qua 00109
After a long period of pushing boulders around, you've found a prize.
'Well, at least there is some reward for the hell that is slexoban',
you think, as you pick up this valuable item. It might come in handy
on the path that lies ahead.
%E
%Cc Qua 00110
As the dreadful Medusa finally stops living, you feel an immense burden
lifted from your chest. You now know that you're a capable adventurer,
one who can defeat creatures from legend and live to tell the tale.

Hopefully, you are now ready to face the greater tasks that lie ahead.
%E
%Cc Qua 00111
This menora surely seems important. It must be one of the artifacts
required for the ominous invocation ritual!

You must get two more of these artifacts. One of them is said to be
in the possession of the Wizard of Yendor himself, who is lurking
somewhere in Gehennom; the other such artifact can be obtained if
you engage your personal nemesis in a duel and win...
%E
%Cc Qua 00112
Quickly, you snatch the papyrus spellbook that the Wizard of Yendor
was holding. It is obviously one of the key pieces in your mission
to open the sanctum at the deepest level of Gehennom, but you also
need the silver bell from your quest nemesis, and one more such
artifact is hidden somewhere in Gehennom.
%E
%Cc Qua 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,
for you know that %d desires this amulet. But something is amiss.

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!
%E
%Cc Qua 00114
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar to %d at last,
you immediately feel an intense surge of power.

You have faced many hardships, survived encounters with deadly
beasts, and even battled the Wizard of Yendor himself and won.
Not to forget carving a path through the Elemental Planes, slaying
their denizens left and right, culminating in the Astral Plane,
where you mowed down all the heretical angels and priests trying
to prevent you from delivering the Amulet to %d.

But now, the entire world around you seems to stop for a moment.
You truly are a demigod now. %d is smiling on you, and leads you
to a place known as the Demigod Bar: Here, the other successful
adventurers are gathered, and they're happily drinking and telling
their stories...

And you get to join them!!! You did it, you've officially become
a true master at your trade, and saved the world from Moloch's
evil schemes! Immediately, you rush to greet your new friends
to tell them about your heroic deeds.

Congraturation! A winner is you! You've beaten SLASH'EM Extended,
one of the most difficult and unfair roguelikes in existence!
Make sure to tell Amy (the creator of the game) about it, too! :-)
%E
%Cc Qua 00115
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar,
you somehow don't feel any different at first.

But it has to be true! You just offered the Amulet to %d,
and should be made a demigod any minute now...

Death, Pestilence and Famine still look as threatening as ever.
Something must be very wrong here. Shouldn't you be safe now,
considering you went through Hell and back to get the Amulet
of Yendor for your deity?

Death reaches out with its deadly touch.
You feel your life draining away...
Pestilence reaches out, and you feel fever and chills.
You feel deathly sick.
Famine reaches out, and your body shrivels.
You faint from lack of food.

On the verge of death, you listen to a voice...
'Foolish mortal, thou art an imbecile poltroon.
But since thou bringest me the Amulet I desired,
I shall let thee live. Thou mayst leave the Dungeon now.'

SHIT! Due to a silly mistake, you failed so close to your goal!
You forgot to make sure that the high altar is actually
consecrated to %d, and offered the Amulet of Yendor to the wrong
deity!

Do you want your possessions identified? DYWYPI?
Game over! Please insert a coin to start a new game.
%E
%Cc Qua 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly
vibrating right beneath you.

This must be the special place where the entrance to
Moloch's sanctum is hidden! In order to open it, you need all three
of the invocation tools: Book, Bell and Candle. And then you have
to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...
%E
%Cc Qua 00117
This peculiar gray stone makes you feel both good and bad at once.
It must surely have great magical power, but there seems to be
some sort of curse on it too.
Maybe if you somehow lift the curse, it will become a truly
useful talisman that can protect you from harm?
%E
