you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!

the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...

%Cc Gam 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,
for you know that %d desires this amulet. But something is amiss.

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!

%Cc Gam 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly

to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...

%Cc Und 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly
vibrating right beneath you.

This must be the special place where the entrance to
Moloch's sanctum is hidden! In order to open it, you need all three
of the invocation tools: Book, Bell and Candle. And then you have
to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...

useful talisman that can protect you from harm?

%Cc Wan 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,
for you know that %d desires this amulet. But something is amiss.

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!
%E
%Cc Wan 00114
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar to %d at last,
you immediately feel an intense surge of power.

You have faced many hardships, survived encounters with deadly
beasts, and even battled the Wizard of Yendor himself and won.
Not to forget carving a path through the Elemental Planes, slaying
their denizens left and right, culminating in the Astral Plane,
where you mowed down all the heretical angels and priests trying
to prevent you from delivering the Amulet to %d.

But now, the entire world around you seems to stop for a moment.
You truly are a demigod now. %d is smiling on you, and leads you
to a place known as the Demigod Bar: Here, the other successful
adventurers are gathered, and they're happily drinking and telling
their stories...

And you get to join them!!! You did it, you've officially become
a true master at your trade, and saved the world from Moloch's
evil schemes! Immediately, you rush to greet your new friends
to tell them about your heroic deeds.

Congraturation! A winner is you! You've beaten SLASH'EM Extended,
one of the most difficult and unfair roguelikes in existence!
Make sure to tell Amy (the creator of the game) about it, too! :-)

%Cc Unt 00113

let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!

%Cc Unt 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly
vibrating right beneath you.

This must be the special place where the entrance to
Moloch's sanctum is hidden! In order to open it, you need all three
of the invocation tools: Book, Bell and Candle. And then you have
to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...

and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!

%Cc Rin 00113

you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!

%Cc Rin 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly

to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...

the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...

some sort of curse on it too.

useful talisman that can protect you from harm?

%Cc For 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,
for you know that %d desires this amulet. But something is amiss.

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!
%E
%Cc For 00114
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar to %d at last,
you immediately feel an intense surge of power.

You have faced many hardships, survived encounters with deadly
beasts, and even battled the Wizard of Yendor himself and won.
Not to forget carving a path through the Elemental Planes, slaying
their denizens left and right, culminating in the Astral Plane,
where you mowed down all the heretical angels and priests trying
to prevent you from delivering the Amulet to %d.

But now, the entire world around you seems to stop for a moment.
You truly are a demigod now. %d is smiling on you, and leads you
to a place known as the Demigod Bar: Here, the other successful
adventurers are gathered, and they're happily drinking and telling
their stories...

And you get to join them!!! You did it, you've officially become
a true master at your trade, and saved the world from Moloch's
evil schemes! Immediately, you rush to greet your new friends
to tell them about your heroic deeds.

Congraturation! A winner is you! You've beaten SLASH'EM Extended,
one of the most difficult and unfair roguelikes in existence!
Make sure to tell Amy (the creator of the game) about it, too! :-)
%E
%Cc For 00115
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar,

Death, Pestilence and Famine still look as threatening as ever.

of Yendor for your deity?

Death reaches out with its deadly touch.
You feel your life draining away...
Pestilence reaches out, and you feel fever and chills.
You feel deathly sick.
Famine reaches out, and your body shrivels.
You faint from lack of food.

On the verge of death, you listen to a voice...
'Foolish mortal, thou art an imbecile poltroon.
But since thou bringest me the Amulet I desired,
I shall let thee live. Thou mayst leave the Dungeon now.'

SHIT! Due to a silly mistake, you failed so close to your goal!
You forgot to make sure that the high altar is actually
consecrated to %d, and offered the Amulet of Yendor to the wrong
deity!

Do you want your possessions identified? DYWYPI?
Game over! Please insert a coin to start a new game.

to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,

%Cc Mid 00103
As you enter the Bell Caves, the silver bell radiates brightly!
You immediately know that you've successfully imbued it; after all, this
is the place where the bell has originally been forged, and it regained
its original power by being close to its source.

In order to open the path to Moloch's Sanctum, you need two more artifacts.
They're both said to be hidden in Gehennom, in the possession of powerful
guardians. Only with them in your possession can you perform the ritual
on the deepest level of Gehennom and gain access to the place where
the Amulet of Yendor is kept.
%E
%Cc Mid 00104

In order to be fully imbued, the Amulet must also be taken to the
Dead Grounds and Ordered Chaos subdungeons.

In order to be fully imbued, the Amulet must also be taken to the
Forging Chamber and Ordered Chaos subdungeons.

The Amulet of Yendor radiates brightly as you enter the Ordered Chaos.

In order to be fully imbued, the Amulet must also be taken to the
Forging Chamber and Dead Grounds subdungeons.
%E
%Cc Mid 00107
At last, you have fully imbued the Amulet of Yendor! You know that now

A strange sensation seems to pull you downwards. This must surely be

and Gehennom again.

You also notice the Wizard of Yendor taunting you in your mind.
He must surely have noticed that the Amulet has gained full power now,
and will try his best to stop you on your ascension run...

on the path that lies ahead.
%E
%Cc Mid 00110
As the dreadful Medusa finally stops living, you feel an immense burden
lifted from your chest. You now know that you're a capable adventurer,
one who can defeat creatures from legend and live to tell the tale.

Hopefully, you are now ready to face the greater tasks that lie ahead.
%E
%Cc Mid 00111
This menora surely seems important. It must be one of the artifacts
required for the ominous invocation ritual!

You must get two more of these artifacts. One of them is said to be

%E
%Cc Mid 00112
Quickly, you snatch the papyrus spellbook that the Wizard of Yendor
was holding. It is obviously one of the key pieces in your mission
to open the sanctum at the deepest level of Gehennom, but you also

artifact is hidden somewhere in Gehennom.
%E
%Cc Mid 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,
for you know that %d desires this amulet. But something is amiss.

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!
%E
%Cc Mid 00114
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar to %d at last,
you immediately feel an intense surge of power.

You have faced many hardships, survived encounters with deadly
beasts, and even battled the Wizard of Yendor himself and won.
Not to forget carving a path through the Elemental Planes, slaying
their denizens left and right, culminating in the Astral Plane,
where you mowed down all the heretical angels and priests trying
to prevent you from delivering the Amulet to %d.

But now, the entire world around you seems to stop for a moment.
You truly are a demigod now. %d is smiling on you, and leads you
to a place known as the Demigod Bar: Here, the other successful
adventurers are gathered, and they're happily drinking and telling
their stories...

And you get to join them!!! You did it, you've officially become
a true master at your trade, and saved the world from Moloch's
evil schemes! Immediately, you rush to greet your new friends
to tell them about your heroic deeds.

Congraturation! A winner is you! You've beaten SLASH'EM Extended,
one of the most difficult and unfair roguelikes in existence!
Make sure to tell Amy (the creator of the game) about it, too! :-)
%E
%Cc Mid 00115
As you offer the Amulet of Yendor on the high altar,
you somehow don't feel any different at first.

But it has to be true! You just offered the Amulet to %d,
and should be made a demigod any minute now...

Death, Pestilence and Famine still look as threatening as ever.
Something must be very wrong here. Shouldn't you be safe now,
considering you went through Hell and back to get the Amulet
of Yendor for your deity?

Death reaches out with its deadly touch.
You feel your life draining away...
Pestilence reaches out, and you feel fever and chills.
You feel deathly sick.
Famine reaches out, and your body shrivels.
You faint from lack of food.

On the verge of death, you listen to a voice...
'Foolish mortal, thou art an imbecile poltroon.
But since thou bringest me the Amulet I desired,
I shall let thee live. Thou mayst leave the Dungeon now.'

SHIT! Due to a silly mistake, you failed so close to your goal!
You forgot to make sure that the high altar is actually
consecrated to %d, and offered the Amulet of Yendor to the wrong
deity!

Do you want your possessions identified? DYWYPI?
Game over! Please insert a coin to start a new game.
%E
%Cc Mid 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly
vibrating right beneath you.

This must be the special place where the entrance to
Moloch's sanctum is hidden! In order to open it, you need all three
of the invocation tools: Book, Bell and Candle. And then you have
to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...
%E
%Cc Mid 00117
This peculiar gray stone makes you feel both good and bad at once.
It must surely have great magical power, but there seems to be
some sort of curse on it too.
Maybe if you somehow lift the curse, it will become a truly
useful talisman that can protect you from harm?

%Cc Pol 00113

let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!

%Cc Pol 00116

to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...

%Cc Aug 00113

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,

let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!

%Cc Aug 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly
vibrating right beneath you.

This must be the special place where the entrance to
Moloch's sanctum is hidden! In order to open it, you need all three
of the invocation tools: Book, Bell and Candle. And then you have
to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...

%Cc Sag 00103

its original power by being close to its source.

They're both said to be hidden in Gehennom, in the possession of powerful
guardians. Only with them in your possession can you perform the ritual
on the deepest level of Gehennom and gain access to the place where
the Amulet of Yendor is kept.

%Cc Sag 00113
Finally, you got what you came for! It's the Amulet of Yendor!!!

Instinctively, you get ready to make a mad dash back to the upstair,
for you know that %d desires this amulet. But something is amiss.

Apparently, the Amulet of Yendor has to be imbued first, or it won't
let you leave the mortal plane. And in order to imbue the Amulet,
you must search Moloch's sanctum for a hidden magic portal that
will lead you to the Yendorian Tower.

Within the Yendorian Tower, three special staircases are hidden.
You must seek everywhere within the Tower, and enter all three such
staircases in order to imbue the Amulet. This is no easy task.
The Yendorian Tower is about as big as the entire Dungeons of Doom
and Gehennom added together, and the staircases can be anywhere.

Also, it is rumored that if the guardians of the three Alignment Keys
are still alive when you enter the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds
and Ordered Chaos areas, they will grow even stronger to haunt you!
%E

their denizens left and right, culminating in the Astral Plane,

But now, the entire world around you seems to stop for a moment.

And you get to join them!!! You did it, you've officially become

%Cc Sag 00116
As you step on this particular floor tile, the ground is suddenly
vibrating right beneath you.

This must be the special place where the entrance to
Moloch's sanctum is hidden! In order to open it, you need all three
of the invocation tools: Book, Bell and Candle. And then you have
to use all three of them in rapid succession while standing on
this exact floor tile.

Additionally, the bell must be imbued before you can complete
the invocation rituals. It needs to be done inside the Subquest,
a branch from where the bell can be found; specifically, the
Bell Caves is the location where imbuing takes place.

You must also make sure to attach seven candles
to the candelabrum, otherwise it won't do what it ought to do.
And the invocation tools better don't be cursed...
%E

#
#       TEST PATTERN
#
%Cc - 00099
 %p:    return(plname);
 %c:    return(pl_character);
 %r:    return((char *)rank_of(u.ulevel));
 %R:    return((char *)rank_of(MIN_QUEST_LEVEL));
 %s:    return((flags.female) ? "sister" : "brother" );
 %S:    return((flags.female) ? "daughter" : "son" );
 %l:    return((char *)ldrname());
 %i:    return(intermed());
 %o:    return(artiname());
 %n:    return((char *)neminame());
 %g:    return((char *)guardname());
 %G:	return((char *)align_gtitle(u.ualignbase[1]));
 %H:    return((char *)homebase());
 %a:	return(Alignnam(u.ualignbase[1]));
 %A:    return(Alignnam(u.ualign.type));
 %d:	return((char *)align_gname(u.ualignbase[1]));
 %D:    return((char *)align_gname(A_LAWFUL));
 %C:    return("chaotic");
 %N:    return("neutral");
 %L:    return("lawful");
 %x:    return((Blind) ? "sense" : "see");
 %Z:	return("The Dungeons of Doom");
 %%:    return(percent_sign);
 a suffix:      return an(root);
 A suffix:      return An(root);
 C suffix:      return capitalized(root);
 p suffix:      return makeplural(root);
 P suffix:      return makeplural(capitalized(root));
 s suffix:      return s_suffix(root);
 S suffix:      return s_suffix(capitalized(root));
 t suffix:      return strip_the_prefix(root);
%E
#
# Alternate legacy text for Walscholar role
#
%Cc - 00194
It is written in the Book of %d:

Grave times have befallen our school. There is an evil
group of girls called the Hussies, and they constantly
attempt to steal the diamonds that were hidden by the
forefathers who once founded this school. The Hussies
use their femininity as a weapon to get what they want,
and few have been able to resist them.

%d has decreed that this has to stop.
The Hussies need to be defeated once and for all, and
since %p is a promising Walscholar, it is now
their obligation to get rid of the Hussy threat.

The supreme leader of the Hussies is called Anna, a
beautiful girl that likes perfume and usually wears
lovely boots. But she commands all the other Hussies
and instructs them to attack relentlessly, which is
why %p has to defeat her anyway. If that can
be accomplished, the school's diamonds will be safe.

However, the Hussies have hired additional help in
the form of the hola-hola brigade, who are going to
try to convert %p to their weird religion.
Hopefully %p can fight or sneak past all the
opposition and infiltrate the depths of this school,
also known as "Gehennom", where Anna keeps her
source of power: the Amulet of Yendor.
The Amulet then needs to be brought up to the high
altar to %d, who will lock it away in a place where
Anna will never be able to get her hands on it again.
Once that is done, the Hussies will cease to be a
threat and peace will be restored at last.

For the sake of us all:  Rescue our school in the name of %d!
%E
#
# Alternate legacy text for Gang Scholar role
#
%Cc - 00198
It is written in the Book of %d:

This is the story of %p, one of the most promising
students attending our school. Since the beginning of
time, %p has been like a %S to me. Unfortunately,
my %S is in the worst class of the entire school.

The core problem is that this class is home to the
feared Bang Gang, a group of pupils who would not come
to learn things. Rather, they want to bully everyone
who doesn't belong to them. %p has always been one
of their victims, with me trying my best to protect
my %S from harm.

Recently, though, things have escalated. It seems that
leading Bang Gang members decided to declare %p their
public enemy number one, and in order to force my %S
to quit school entirely, they hired help. For this school
also houses the Hussy Club, a group of girls who will
fulfill any request for the right price, as long as it
involves making someone's life hard. And obviously,
the Bang Gang was the highest bidder.

As a result, %p now has to endure the attacks of Anna
and her fellow hussies as well, in addition to whatever
cruel things the Bang Gangers are doing. The hussies
happily steal my %S's pocket money, or humiliate %p
in public, or whatever floats their mind. This is
intolerable, and the evil perpetrators have to be stopped.

Therefore, %p will have to undertake a perilous journey
and complete a very difficult task. For Anna's source of
power is hidden deep in this school, in an area commonly
named "Gehennom". My %S has to venture there, avoid or
defeat all of Anna's guards and the members of the Bang Gang
that want to prevent the Amulet of Yendor from being stolen,
and bring it to me.

Once that has been done, Anna will lose all of her special
powers, and her hussies will be unable to bully my pupils
ever again. This is no easy mission for %p, I'm aware of that,
but I'll use my power to protect my %S from Anna and the
Bang Gangers along the grueling path that lies ahead.

For the sake of us all:  Rescue our school in the name of %d!
%E

# Alternate legacy text for Convict role
#
%Cc - 00199
It is written in the Book of %d:

    After the Creation, the cruel god Moloch rebelled
    against the authority of Marduk the Creator.
    Moloch stole from Marduk the most powerful of all
    the artifacts of the gods, the Amulet of Yendor,
    and he hid it in the dark cavities of Gehennom, the
    Under World, where he now lurks, and bides his time.

Your %G %d seeks to possess the Amulet, and with it
to gain deserved ascendance over the other gods.

You, a newly escaped %r, have chosen to redeem
yourself by recovering the Amulet for %d.  You are
determined to recover the Amulet for your deity, or die
in the attempt.  Your hour of destiny has come.  For
the sake of us all:  Go bravely with %d!
%E

%Cc - 00197
You fail at reading comprehension forever. The Amulet
of Yendor needs to be imbued, and you were told about that
many times!!! Now you have to take it back all the way
to Moloch's sanctum, enter the Yendorian Tower, and
imbue it by finding and entering the Forging Chamber,
Dead Grounds and Ordered Chaos.
%E
%Cc - 00196
Remember: The Amulet of Yendor needs to be imbued first.
As long as that has not been done, you will not be able
to reach the Elemental Planes to deliver the amulet to %d.
Seek the hidden magic portal on Moloch's sanctum to gain
access to the Yendorian Tower. From there, you need to
look for three special staircases that lead to
the Forging Chamber, Dead Grounds and Ordered Chaos.
Enter each of these areas while holding the Amulet of Yendor,
and it will be imbued. After completing that process, you
need to head to the surface.
%E
%Cc - 00195
It seems that this magical bell needs to be imbued, otherwise
it simply won't work. In order to imbue it, you need to
search the Quest levels 2-6 and find a magic portal somewhere,
which will take you to the Subquest. Somewhere in that Subquest,
a staircase is hidden that will take you to the Bell Caves.
Entering the Bell Caves will imbue the bell, allowing it to work.
%E
